paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted genetic variant information for the TTR gene, including penetrance data.

patients.demographics: geriatric patients, predominantly male, diverse ethnic backgrounds

individual_records.evidence_sentence: Among those patients who presented at 90 years or older, and for whom renal function tests were available, fewer were at stage II and more at stage I and III.
In contrast, among ATTRwt patients, the incidence of stage III increased with age.
Among geriatric patients, ATTR Val30Met was the second most commonly observed mutation.

functional_data.summary: The Val122Ile mutation is associated with a higher prevalence of cardiac symptoms.

variants.segregation_data: The variant segregates with disease in families.
variants.additional_notes: The study highlights the importance of recognizing the Val122Ile mutation in geriatric patients.
key_quotes: Val122Ile mutation was highly prevalent among geriatric patients.
Among ATTRv patients, the proportion of patients with symptomatic peripheral neuropathy and/or orthostatic hypotension was significantly higher among non-geriatric patients.

patients.demographics: geriatric patients, predominantly male, diverse ethnic backgrounds

functional_data.summary: The Val30Met mutation is associated with a different clinical presentation.

variants.additional_notes: The Val30Met mutation was noted as the second most common in geriatric patients.
key_quotes: Among geriatric patients, ATTR Val30Met was the second most commonly observed mutation.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data extracted from the main text.
